Publications

  • Ordonez, A., Williams, J. W., and Svenning, J. C. (2016) Climatic novelty, displacement, and divergence: implications for the emergence of novel communities Nature Climate Change 10.1038/nclimate3127

  • Graham, R. W., Belmecheri, S., Choy, K., Culleton, B., Davies, L. J., Froese, D., Heintzman, P. D., Hritz, C., Kapp, J. D., Newsom, L. A., Rawcliffe, R., Saulnier-Talbot, E., Shapiro, B., Wang, Y., Williams, J. W., and Wooller, M. J. (2016) Timing and causes of a middle Holocene mammoth extinction on St. Paul Island, Alaska. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 113: 9310-9314.

Public Data, Visualizations, and other Resources

Neotoma Paleoecology Database Neotoma is a community-curated data repository for paleoecological data. Tilia Tilia is software used to upload and download data from Neotoma Earth Life Consortium A portal to jointly query from Neotoma, the PBDB, and other paleobiological resources. Range Mapper Range Mapper is a set of interactive animated visualizations of species distributions since the last ice age. This is a successor to Pollen Viewer. Pollen Viewer Note: Pollen Viewer is now defunct, but you can download the animated gifs and individual images from here. GitHub Code Repository for Williams Lab Presentations on figShare Powerpoints from public presentations by Williams

Private Data - Williams Lab
